intro: Peucedanum kingaense, commonly known as Kinga's angelica, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of East Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stem and compound leaves with a distinctive fern-like appearance. Its flowers are small and greenish-yellow, arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Peucedanum kingaense is adapted to cool, moist environments and is often found in montane forests.
